subject: Re: [junit] Conditional tearDown()
msgSnippet: ... Is this intended to be more efficient than just clearing the database every time the tearDown() method is invoked, or am I missing something? Mike -- Mike
messageBody:
Brian wrote:

>I see in the TestResult class there's a method wasSuccessful(). From
>within class that extends TestCase, I want to do something like this:
>
> public void tearDown()
> {
> TestResult result = createResult();
> if( result.wasSuccessful() )
> {
> System.out.println( "Clearing database" );
> clearDatabase( "1" );
> }
> }
>
>

Is this intended to be more efficient than just clearing the database
every time the tearDown() method is invoked, or am I missing something?

Mike
